content_blocks.title: Advanced Topic Ahead

content.text: You're about to learn Incident Response Automation, an advanced technique used by real-world threat actors and security professionals. This knowledge is powerful and must be used ethically.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Think of this like learning advanced martial arts - powerful, but requires responsibility.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: This technique is actively used in real-world attacks and defenses.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: How would you use this knowledge to improve security?

content_blocks.title: Incident Response Automation

content.text: This lesson covers: SOAR platforms, Playbooks, Automated response, Orchestration. These are advanced techniques requiring solid fundamentals.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Core concept: SOAR platforms enables attackers (or defenders) to soar and playbook development.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Real threat actors use Incident Response Automation daily in active campaigns.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: What security controls could prevent or detect this technique?

post_assessment.question: What is SOAR?
post_assessment.explanation: SOAR platforms automate incident response tasks and orchestrate security tool workflows.

post_assessment.question: What should be automated in IR?
options: Repetitive, time-consuming tasks like enrichment and containment
post_assessment.explanation: Automate repetitive tasks (enrichment, initial containment) while keeping critical decisions manual.
